title: Etc . listings : Feb . 3 - 9
body_text:
COMEDY
Nikki Glaser: The Good Girl Tour: 8 p.m.; Feb. 4; Hard Rock Live Orlando, 6050 Universal Blvd. in Orlando; $32-$42
Family-Friendly Comedy Show: A family-friendly comedy show that is sure to make you slap your knee and laugh out loud. Our world-class improvisers make up a whole show from nothing in the style of “Whose Line Is It Anyway?” 7:30 p.m.; Feb. 3; Rec Room, 202 N. Massachusetts Ave. in Lakeland; $10-$15; swancityimprov.com
FOOD
2023 UNCF Leaders’ Breakfast — Seminole: 8:30 a.m.; Feb. 8; 301 W. 7th St. in Sanford; uncf.org
CFAWL February 2023 Luncheon: Please join us for our next #FirstFriday luncheon. 12 p.m.; Feb. 3; Citrus Club — 18th floor, 255 S. Orange Ave. in Orlando; cfawl.ticketleap.com
Lunch & Learn: Test your Central Florida knowledge at this “Did You Know?” program, featuring stories highlighting the diverse and fascinating history of the region. 9 a.m.; Feb. 3; Orange County Regional History Center, 65 E. Central Blvd. in Orlando; 407-836-8580, 407-836-8500; thehistorycenter.org
Pancake Breakfast: Join our community for a delicious pancake breakfast. 8 a.m.; Feb. 4; 7101 Wright Ave. in Tangerine; $8; mountdora.com
Taco and Margarita Festival: The Orlando Taco and Margarita Festival comes to Camping World Stadium with big, bold flavors for all to enjoy. 12 p.m.; Feb. 4; Camping World Stadium, 1 Citrus Bowl Place in Orlando; campingworldstadium.com
Uptown Downtown Marina Mixer: After-hours networking event for Uptown/Downtown Businesses. 5:30 p.m.; Feb. 9; Mount Dora Boating Center & Marina, 148 Charles Ave. in Mount Dora; mountdora.com
Wine, Dine and Be Mine: 6 p.m.; Feb. 8; Osceola County Welcome Center, 4155 W. Vine St. in Kissimmee; osceolahistory.org
EOCC Great Lunch Adventures: Join the East Orlando Chamber as we go on a creative culinary adventure throughout the East with our “Great Lunch Adventures.” 12:30 p.m.; Feb. 7; Various locations in East Orange County, Visit eocc.org for details; Orlando; free; eocc.chambermaster.com
League of Women Voters Hot Topics: Black Resistance: 11:30 a.m.; Feb. 8; Winter Park Events Center, 1050 W. Morse Blvd. in Winter Park; $30-$37; 407-735-6540; lwvoc.org
Taco & Tequila Tuesday: Enjoy live music from DJ Chino and 25% off a new featured cocktail every Tuesday. 5-9 p.m.; Feb. 7; LIME Fresh Mexican Grill, 13052 Narcoossee Road in Orlando; free; 407-440-3121
W.I.S.E. (Women in Successful Endeavors) Business Women Networking Luncheon: 11:30 a.m.; Feb. 8; Hilton Garden Inn Orlando East UCF Area, 1959 N. Alafaya Trail in Orlando; $40-$50; eocc.chambermaster.com
Beer Bingo!: Join us at Ellipsis Brewing every Wednesday for Beer Bingo. 6 p.m.; Feb. 8; Ellipsis Brewing, 7500 TPC Blvd., Suite 8, in Orlando; free; cli.re
Coffee Club Downtown: What happens when you mix a group of energetic businesspeople, add unique opportunities like Monopoly, Family Feud and Real-World Thursday panels plus timely speakers, champion networking and connections. 8:30 a.m.; Feb. 9; American Freight Furniture, 4308 E. Colonial Drive in Orlando; free; 407-277-5951; eocc.chambermaster.com
Cuisine Corner: Chef Ingrid Alliance of Pinch of My Cuisine shares her recipe for soup joumou — a squash-based soup traditionally prepared for Haitian Independence Day. Registration required. 12 p.m.; Feb. 7; South Trail Branch, 4600 S. Orange Blossom Trail in Orlando; free; 407-835-7323; attend.ocls.info
FESTIVALS & FAIRS
Faire of the Dog Valentine Market: 2 p.m.; Feb. 5; Will’s Pub, 1040 N. Mills Ave. in Orlando; free
Groundhog Gala: Experience the Misfires Car Club’s 23rd annual pre-1964 classic car, truck and motorcycle show and hootenanny in downtown Sanford. 10 a.m.; Feb. 4; Henry’s Depot, 212 W. First St. in Sanford; free; 407-324-2276; facebook.com
Conway Community Market: We are a once-monthly community market held on certain Sundays. 10 a.m.; Feb. 5; Barber Park, 3701 Gatlin Ave. in Orlando; free; 407-739-7005; conwaycommunity.com
Getdown Downtown Mardi Gras Street Party: Party like Mardi Gras at Maitland’s next Getdown Downtown street party. The Jammin’ Jambalaya Zydeco Band will perform on stage. 6 p.m.; Feb. 3; Maitland City Hall, 1776 Independence Lane in Maitland; free; 407-539-6223; itsmymaitland.com
Oviedo Mall Carnival: There’s something for everyone at this family-fun event, from thrilling midway rides and games for all ages to tasty fair food for every appetite. Carnival admission and parking are free. 5 p.m.; Feb. 3-9; Oviedo Mall, 1700 Oviedo Mall Blvd. in Oviedo; free; dreamlandamusements.com
Pawsing for Pets at the Conway Community Market: Attention all pet lovers. Join us for the Pawsing for Pets Conway Community Market annual Pet Fair. 10 a.m.; Feb. 5; Barber Park, 3701 Gatlin Ave. in Orlando; free; 407-739-7005; fb.me
Dragon Parade 2023: The Year of the Rabbit marks the 11th Annual Central Florida Dragon Parade Lunar New Year. 11 a.m.; Feb. 5; Mills 50 District, 728 N. Thornton Ave. in Orlando; free; 407-496-7338; centralfloridadragonparade.org
FILM
Beyond the Valley of the Dolls: Celebrating Russ Meyer’s 100th Birthday. Feb. 3; Enzian Theater, 1300 S. Orlando Ave. in Maitland; 407-629-1088; enzian.org
One Hundred and One Dalmatians: Join us for Popcorn Flicks in the Park. They are free and open to the public. We encourage you to bring a blanket, a picnic or snacks, and some family and friends and join us. 7 p.m.; Feb. 9; Enzian Theater, 1300 S. Orlando Ave. in Maitland; enzian.org
Winter Film Series: National Trust Unlocked: In this six-part series, English architect George Clarke takes viewers on a tour of some of the homes, gardens and properties cared for by the National Trust in Britain. 12 p.m.; Feb. 3; The Charles Hosmer Morse Museum of American Art, 445 N. Park Ave. in Winter Park; orlandoatplay.com
LITERARY ARTS
WEE Story Time: Stories, finger plays, books, bubbles and toys. 11 a.m.; Feb. 7; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
An Evening of Music & Poetry: Join poet Tanner Olson and singer-songwriter Blake Flattley for an evening of music and poetry. 7 p.m.; Feb. 3; Oviedo; bandsintown.com
Friends of the Library Meeting: 10 a.m.; Feb. 8; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks; Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
D&D: Come join us at the library for high adventure as we play fifth-edition Dungeons & Dragons. The group is currently full and has moved to a waiting list pending a new DM. 4:30 p.m.; Feb. 9; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
First Saturdays, History Alive! Celebrating Community: On the first Saturday of every month, the past comes alive at the Orange County Regional History Center. 11 a.m.; Feb. 4; Orange County Regional History Center, 65 E. Central Blvd. in Orlando; free; 407-836-8500; thehistorycenter.org
Friends of the Library Winter Book Sale: 9 a.m.; Feb. 3-4, Feb. 6; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Story Time at Leu: Share stories, songs and fun with your little one on the first Monday of each month. This is a free indoor event. 10 a.m.; Feb. 6; Harry P. Leu Gardens, 1920 N. Forest Ave. in Orlando; 407-246-2620; orlandoatplay.com
Teen Hangout: Come meet up and unwind at the library. Play games with friends, get creative, join in on a project or just hang out. (Find us in the “Story Hour Room”, located inside the kids room) 4 p.m.; Feb. 9; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Take your child to the library day: Visit us at Pioneer Village as we partner with Osceola’s Hart Memorial Library, browse their sample of Osceola History Books and sign up for a library card. 10 a.m.; Feb. 4; Pioneer Village at Shingle Creek, 2491 Babb Road in Kissimmee; osceolahistory.org
SABR Day: The Central Florida Chapter of the Society for American Baseball Research (SABR) celebrates National SABR Day with a free event. 10 a.m.; Feb. 4; First Baptist Orlando, 3000 S. John Young Parkway in Orlando; free; 386-846-9132; sabr.org
First Tuesday Write and Read: To motivate and inspire you to write your life stories, Writing Your Life and Life Writers invite you to join our free virtual write-ins and feedback sessions on the first Tuesday of every month. 6 p.m.; Feb. 7; Orlando; free; orlandoatplay.com
FAMILY
Dance Depot Daddy Daughter Dance: 3 p.m.; Feb. 5; 2708 W. Old Hwy 441 in Mount Dora; $5-$20; fun4lakekids.com
Family Day: No passports are needed for this journey. Travel through the galleries and enjoy live multicultural performances, gallery and art activities and more. 11 a.m.; Feb. 4; Orlando Museum of Art, 2416 N. Mills Ave. in Orlando; 407-896-4231; omart.org
Mr. Richard: Teatime Dance Party with Mr. Richard. 10 a.m.; Feb. 3; Infusion Tea, 1600 Edgewater Drive in Orlando; free; 407-999-5255; mrrichard.net
Mr. Richard: Family Night with Mr. Richard. 6 p.m.; Feb. 7; Chick-Fil-A Waterford Lakes Town Center, 633 N. Alafaya Trail in Orlando; free; 407-281-8897; mrrichard.net
Mr. Richard: Dancing and ice cream with Mr. Richard 10:30 a.m.; Feb. 9; Foxtail Coffee Co. Howell Branch, 2451 Howell Market Lane in Winter Park; free; 407-571-9413; mrrichard.net
Support Group for Alzheimer’s & Dementia Caregivers: The Alzheimer’s Dementia Resource Center provides facilitated support groups for caregivers, family members and friends providing care to persons living with a dementia-related illness. 10 a.m.; Feb. 9; Maitland Presbyterian Church Conference Room, 341 N. Orlando Ave. in Maitland; free; 407-436-7750; adrccares.org
DNA Special Interest Group: The study of family history doesn’t only have to do with documents and studying a location. With a DNA test result, you can learn more about your living relatives. 1:30 p.m.; Feb. 8; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
KIDS
Kids Adventure Club: Join in for fun after-school activities. 3 p.m.; Feb. 8; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Kids Night at Chick Fil A Mount Dora: 5 p.m.; Feb. 6; Highway 441 in Mount Dora; free; fun4lakekids.com
Playtime with Punch & Judy!: Orlando Shakes’ youth and teen classes focus on skill sets that benefit youth and teens on stage as well as in everyday life. 9 a.m.; Feb. 4; Orlando Shakes, 812 E. Rollins St. in Orlando; free; orlandoatplay.com
Story Drama: Make Way for Duckling (4-5-year-olds): Quack! Quack! Off we go! Using the actor’s toolbox of the body, voice and imagination, students adventure throughout the city with the Mallard family. 9 a.m.; Feb. 4; Orlando Repertory Theatre, 1001 E. Princeton St. in Orlando; $150; orlandoatplay.com
Toddler Open Gym: 10:30 a.m.; Feb. 6; St. Cloud Civic Center, 3001 17th St. in St. Cloud; 407-957-7300; stcloudfl.gov
Toddler Time: 10 a.m.; Feb. 9; Dreamcatcher Horse Rescue, 10639 Toad Road in Clermont; $25; fun4lakekids.com
Rosen JCC After School Program and Registration: The Rosen JCC After School Program gives kids homework help, snacks and fun activities. It offers enrichment classes in ballet, soccer and karate. 3 p.m.; Feb. 3-9; Rosen Event Center, 11184 S. Apopka-Vineland Road in Orlando; rosenjcc.org
OUTDOOR RECREATION
Christine Reed: Christine Reed, author of “Alone in Wonderland,” will give a lecture about nature and her journey to becoming a backpacker. 3 p.m.; Feb. 8; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Forgotten Florida: Just 30 minutes east of the Orlando Airport lies an expansive untouched wilderness. 6 a.m.; Feb. 4; 3365 Taylor Creek Road in Christmas; trailrunner.com
Offense-Defense All-American Bowl: The Offense-Defense All-American Bowl at Camping World Stadium is offered to the top players in the country that show the ability to handle rigorous training and uphold themselves to a higher standard. 7 p.m.; Feb. 5; Camping World Stadium, 1 Citrus Bowl Place in Orlando; campingworldstadium.com
PURSUITS & HOBBIES
Four Corners Sit & Sew: 1 p.m.; Feb. 6; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Cooper Crafter’s Group: Bring your current project (be it yarn, thread, bead, fiber or paper) and craft with us. 2 p.m.; Feb. 9; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Cooper Quilters Group: Calling all quilters! Bring your current project and quilt with us. 9 a.m.; Feb. 7, Feb. 9; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Fun on the Farm at Puzzle Ranch: 12 p.m.; Feb. 4; 33348 County Road 437 in Sorrento; free; fun4lakekids.com
Knitting/Crochet Group for Adults: Knitting and crochet group for adults at Cagan Crossings Library. Come along with your latest project and create, connect and chat. All skill levels are welcome. 3 p.m.; Feb. 9; Cagan Crossings Community Library, 16729 Cagan Oaks in Clermont; 352-253-6180; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Master Gardener Plant Clinic: Join our Master Gardeners for presentations and plant clinic. You will be able to get answers to your gardening questions. 1 p.m.; Feb. 6; DeBary Public Library, 200 N. Charles Richard Beall Blvd. in DeBary; google.com
Mount Dora Village Market: 10 a.m.; Feb. 5; Mount Dora; mountdora.com
Orlando Scrabble Club: The Orlando Scrabble Club is the best place for meeting other players in the Orlando, Casselberry or central Florida areas. 7 p.m.; Feb. 6; Wirz Park Recreation Building, 806 Mark David Blvd. in Casselberry; free; orlandoscrabble.com
Pastfinders Present: In-person at Cooper Memorial Library and virtual on ZoomProgram. Speaker: Debbie Wilson Smyth. Program Topic: Researching Probate Records: Looking beyond the Will. 4:30 p.m.; Feb. 9; Cooper Memorial Library, 2525 Oakley Seaver Drive in Clermont; mylakelibrary.evanced.info
Amplifier Building: 5 Watt Edition: In this course, the students will get to build their very own custom 5-Watt Tube Amp, designed exclusively for El Camino School by ValveTrain Amplification. 10 a.m.; Feb. 4-5; El Camino School of Music, Repair & Technology, 1510 E. Colonial Drive, Suite 103, in Orlando; $1,000; 407-734-5129; elcaminoschool.com
Game Night: Grab your friends and join us for Game Night every Friday night at Ellipsis Brewing. We do have a small selection of board games, card games, etc. 6 p.m.; Feb. 3; Ellipsis Brewing, 7500 TPC Blvd., Suite 8, in Orlando; free; 407-250-5848; cli.re
Reactoonz review: Learn a lot regarding reactoonz. 10 a.m.; Feb. 7, Feb. 8; Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts, 445 S Magnolia Ave. in Orlando; free; 929-835-6793; reactoonz.org
